metadata.synopsis: When a touring swing band arrives in her small town, Connie Ward (Ann Rutherford) falls hard for trumpeter Bill Abbot (George Montgomery) and decides to marry him on a whim -- since the band is leaving as quickly as it arrived. Quite unprepared for her new lifestyle, Connie struggles to adjust to the constant travel from one town to another, and also to the pettiness of the other musicians' wives. Eventually, the marriage and the band break up, but Bill is determined to make it all right again.

reviews: It is important for the youth to know that the Glenn Miller Orchestra has the most important role in the movie. [Full Review in Spanish]
The Glenn Miller Orchestra is THE reason to catch this WWII musical.
a bared teeth comedy about the gossiping and back biting that goes on among the wives of the band members.
Mr. Miller and his assorted virtuosos are killers when it comes to making jive, but it takes more than wind and willingness to support a ninety-seven-minute film.
